topic.title: Associating Concepts with a Specification Reference Set

body.section: To create a reference set, you must specify which concepts will be members (and which will not) in the specification refset.
The Refset Entries toggle button displays or hides the links to reference sets for the selected concept.

section.title: Adding a Concept to a Specification Reference Set Specification Reference Set refset specification

body.section: To add the selected concept to an existing refset, click on the Add Concept Extension button . The default refset will appear in the refset column. To change this value to another refset, double-click it. A dropdown box will appear with the names of all existing refets; select the desired one. (To select the default refset, see section below.

fig.title: Changing the Refset Associated with the Concept

section.title: Selecting the Concept Inclusion Type Inclusion Type

body.section: When linking a concept to a refset, its inclusion type must be specified as either exclude individual, exclude lineage, individual include, or lineage include. (See section for a detailed description of these inclusion types.)

When the concept is first added to a reference set, an inclusion type will be assigned by default (as set in the Preferences panel). To modify this value, double-click on it in the concept column. A list of values will pop-up; select the desired value. Alternatively, right click on the entry and select Change concept to display the pop-up list.

section.title: Changing the Refset Association Status Association Status refset

body.section: The default refset status is normally set as current. (Other values are defined in the Refset preferences.) To modify this value, double-click on it in the status column. A list of values will pop-up; select the desired value. Alternatively, right-click on the entry and select Change status to display the pop-up list.

The refset associations entered are provisional. No changes are made to the database until you click the commit button (at the bottom right of the winÂ­dow). If you do not wish to apply these entries, click the cancel button (next to the commit button) to clear the provisional refset associations from the display. They will not be applied to the database.
